ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.local

Class MediaManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.local.StoringManager<Media>
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301f13t13.storyhoard.local.MediaManager

  • public class MediaManager
extends StoringManager<Media>
    Role: Interacts with the database to store, update, and retrieve media objects. It implements the StoringManager interface. The setup of the database being used is defined in DBContract.java, so for more information on the actual tables and SQL statements used to make them, see that class. Design Pattern: This class is a singleton, so there will ever only be one instance of it. Use the getInstance() static method to retrieve an instance of it, not the constructor.
    Author:
    Stephanie Gil, Ashley Brown
    See Also:
    Media, StoringManager, DBContract

      void insert(Media media)
      Saves a new media into the database.

      Example Call.
      Media media = new Media("3242a21d", "/path/", "photo", "hello world");
      MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
      mm.insert(media);
      void remove(java.util.UUID id)
      Removes the media from the database
      java.util.ArrayList<Media> retrieve(Media criteria)
      Retrieves a media from the database.

      The media passed into this method is a media holding search criteria, so any field you would like to include in the search, just set the search criteria holding story to it.

      Example Call.
      Media media = new Media("3242a21d", "/path/", "photo", "hello world");
      MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
      mm.insert(media);
      To now search for this media based on its text:

      Media criteria = new Media(null, null, null, null, "hello world");

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static MediaManager getInstance(Context context)
        Returns an instance of a MediaManager. Since this class is a singleton, the same instance will always be returned. This is the method any class outside of this one and any subclasses should use to get an mediaManager object.

        Used to implement the singleton design pattern.
        Parameters:
        context -

      • insert

        public void insert(Media media)
        Saves a new media into the database.

        Example Call.
        Media media = new Media("3242a21d", "/path/", "photo", "hello world");
        MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        mm.insert(media);
        Specified by:
        insert in class StoringManager<Media>
        Parameters:
        media - A media object.

      • retrieve

        public java.util.ArrayList<Media> retrieve(Media criteria)
        Retrieves a media from the database.

        The media passed into this method is a media holding search criteria, so any field you would like to include in the search, just set the search criteria holding story to it.

        Example Call.
        Media media = new Media("3242a21d", "/path/", "photo", "hello world");
        MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        mm.insert(media);
        To now search for this media based on its text:

        Media criteria = new Media(null, null, null, null, "hello world");
        Specified by:
        retrieve in class StoringManager<Media>
        Parameters:
        criteria - A media with the criteria in it.
        Returns:
        objects

      • update

        public void update(Media newMedia)
        Updates a media already in the database. Example Call.
        Example Call.
        Media media = new Media("3242a21d", "/path/", "photo", "hello world");
        MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        mm.insert(media);
        media.setText("bah humbug");
        mm.update(media);
        Specified by:
        update in class StoringManager<Media>
        Parameters:
        newMedia - Media with changes.

        Overrides:

      • syncDeletions

        public void syncDeletions(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.UUID> newMedias,
                 java.util.UUID chapId)
        Removes the media no longer in a chapter
        Parameters:
        ArrayList - newMedias The ArrayList of the media you want in the chapter.
        chapId - This is the id of the chapter the new media will be in.

      • getPhotosByChapter

        public java.util.ArrayList<Media> getPhotosByChapter(java.util.UUID chapterId)
        Retrieves the photos whose chapter id matches the id provided. It expects the id provided to be a UUID.

        Example call:
        UUID id = UUID.fromString("5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7");
        MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        ArrayList photos = mm.getById(id);
        Parameters:
        chapterId - Id of the chapter we are looking in. Must be a UUID.

      • getIllustrationsByChapter

        public java.util.ArrayList<Media> getIllustrationsByChapter(java.util.UUID chapterId)
        Retrieves the illustrations whose chapter id matches the id provided. It expects the id provided to be a UUID.

        Example call:
        UUID id = UUID.fromString("5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7");
        MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        ArrayList illustrations = mm.getById(id);
        Parameters:
        chapterId - Id of the chapter we are looking in. Must be a UUID.

      • getById

        public Media getById(java.util.UUID id)
        Retrieves the media whose id matches the id provided. It expects the id provided to be a UUID.

        Example call:
        UUID id = UUID.fromString("5231b533-ba17-4787-98a3-f2df37de2aD7");
        MediaManager mm = MediaManager.getInstance(someActivity.this);
        Media m = mm.getById(id);
        Specified by:
        getById in class StoringManager<Media>
        Parameters:
        id - Id of the media we are looking for. Must be a UUID.
